meanings.definition: A medieval association of merchants or towns for the promotion of commerce.
meanings.sent1: The hanse worked together to sell their goods.
meanings.sent2: The hanse of merchants met regularly to discuss trade.
meanings.sent3: The hanse of towns decided to host a grand market festival.
meanings.sent4: Their hanse was like a tightly knit web of business connections.
meanings.sent5: In the bustling marketplace, the hanse members stood out with their colorful banners.

meanings.definition: A league or alliance, especially of cities or towns.
meanings.sent1: The cities formed a hanse to protect each other from invaders.
meanings.sent2: The hanse of towns united to improve infrastructure in the region.
meanings.sent3: The hanse of cities threw a celebratory feast to mark their alliance.
meanings.sent4: Their hanse stood strong against any external threats.
meanings.sent5: The hanse of towns was a beacon of unity in times of trouble.
